<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/18/canada-extends-border-restrictions-us?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The US-Canada Border Is Still Closed, so Sorry
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="A Gif of a person getting blocked from entering the Canadian border on Conan" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=503 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/31WY9AkAiJSUaDYri8/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="A Gif of a person getting blocked from entering the Canadian border on Conan" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/31WY9AkAiJSUaDYri8/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Your dreams of trying an authentic Montreal bagel are still limited to allowing a New York City one to get stale. Yesterday, Canada <a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/us/canada-extends-us-travel-restrictions-through-july-21-2021-06-18/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">extended restrictions</a> on nonessential travel across the US border until July 22.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Those restrictions have been in place since March 2020, when countries across the globe shut down international travel to curb the spread of Covid-19.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Many are, in a word, frustrated</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The US’ and Canada’s economies are more intertwined than CatDog.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And while goods can be shuttled between the two countries, the tourism and services industries on both sides of the border are feeling the pinch. Lawmakers and businesses in both the US and Canada have <a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/canada-extends-ban-non-essential-travel-with-us-until-july-21-2021-06-18/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lashed out</a> at the Canadian government for what they say is putting politics over science.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“The complete lockdown we’ve experienced is not consistent with science and it’s very, very bad for our economy,” said US Rep. Chris Jacobs of New York.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"We need to open the border for fully vaccinated travelers immediately," Harley Finkelstein, the president of Canadian ecommerce giant Shopify, tweeted.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">About those vaccinations...</strong>to keep the virus at bay, Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has said the border would stay mostly closed until 75% of the population has received the first dose and 20% have been fully vaccinated. As of yesterday, 65% had received a first dose and nearly 17% had been fully vaxxed, per the <a href="https://covid19tracker.ca/vaccinationtracker.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Covid-19 Tracker Canada project</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Canadian and American businesses that rely on cross-border traffic are getting FOMO as other countries open up to international travelers. Yesterday, the European Council <a href="https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/eu-lifts-travel-restrictions-for-us-travelers/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recommended</a> that EU countries gradually lift restrictions on non-essential travel from 14 countries, including the US.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENVIRONMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/18/western-us-suffering-severe-drought?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The West Is July 5-Level Thirsty
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/18/western-us-suffering-severe-drought?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="LAKE MEAD NATIONAL RECREATION AREA, NV - MAY 12:  A sign warning boaters..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NDkyL2xha2VfbWVhZF9hdF9oaXN0b3JpY19sb3cuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Justin Sullivan/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">88% of the American West is currently experiencing a drought, and the US’ largest reservoir, Lake Mead, is at <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/06/18/weather/west-drought-impact-colorado-river/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">its lowest level</a> since it was filled in the 1930s. With a record-breaking heat wave sizzling its way across the West this week, officials will almost certainly declare the first-ever water shortage for the Colorado River, which feeds Lake Mead.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The shortage will affect much more than Californians’ shower times. No “good” in this list but here’s...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The bad: agriculture. </strong>Rising water prices and dwindling government subsidies means farmers are letting fields of almonds (one of California’s most lucrative crops), tomatoes, and other produce <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/drought-imperils-economy-in-californias-farm-country-11621589407?mod=article_inline" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">go fallow</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The ugly: fishing. </strong>17 million salmon are being <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2021/jun/11/california-to-transport-17m-salmon-to-the-sea-by-truck-as-drought-bites?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">chauffeured</a> from drying rivers to the ocean, possibly costing more than $800,000 but saving 23,000 industry jobs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The also-bad-and-ugly:</strong> <strong style="color:#000">power.</strong> Grids are already struggling to keep the A/C running, and capacity at hydroelectric power facilities is <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/west-risks-blackouts-as-hydroelectric-power-dries-up-11624008601?mod=hp_lead_pos6" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">plummeting</a>. At Lake Mead’s Hoover Dam, it’s down 25%.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>fire season could start earlier and <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/06/17/weather/california-vegetation-wildfire-risk/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">last longer</a> than usual because of this drought.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SHIPPING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/18/delays-yantian-port-shutdown-worse-suez-canal-fiasco?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Yantian Port to Suez Canal: Hold My Bottleneck
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In 2021, even Santa isn’t immune to supply chain fiascos. Severe backlogs at Chinese ports are <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/06/17/business/china-ports-global-supply-chain-intl-hnk/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">threatening disruptions</a> in electronics, appliances, furniture, and toys just as the retail industry prepares for its peak holiday shipping season in August.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory</strong>: The worst of the shipping bottleneck is at Yantian, the largest port in China and the one that exports >90% of the world’s electronics. Last month, a spike in Covid cases led to a total lockdown in Guangdong, the southern Chinese province where Yantian and other busy ports are located, for about a week. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Cases have since dropped and the port is back to operating at about 70% capacity, but it’s too late. ~160,000 containers are still waiting to be shipped, and experts <a href="https://www.scmp.com/economy/china-economy/article/3137920/china-shipping-yantian-port-delays-already-worse-those-caused?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">say</a> the delays caused by this backlog are worse than when the Ever Given got stuck in the Suez Canal.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Analysts have noted that stop-and-start supply chains are one of the main factors driving inflation to its highest levels in years—and as long as Covid-19 is around, disruptions seem to be the new normal.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MONEY MATTERS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/18/money-matters-retirement-saving-comes-two-flavors?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Money Matters: Retirement Saving Comes in Two Flavors
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>In this new Summer 2021 segment, the Brew’s personal finance writer Ryan Lasker is nose-diving into our inbox to address your personal finance questions. </em><a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/24127283.23936/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9tMDZUYmRVUz91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77B5ca46cdd?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Submit your money woes here</em></a><em>.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">I have recently been hired for my first full-time position. The company is offering a 401(k) plan, but I also have a separate Roth IRA. Which one should I prioritize maxing out first?—Calla from Hawaii</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Congrats on the new gig. I’m going to use you as a shining example that it’s never too early to save for retirement.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To answer your question, those sweet, sweet tax benefits of 401(k) and IRA retirement plans come in two flavors: traditional and Roth.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Traditional plans</strong></span><span> let you contribute a portion of your paycheck before income taxes, but you’ll pay them on withdrawals in retirement. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Roth plan</strong></span><span> contributions are taxed now, not later.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Your <em>first</em> priority should be to take advantage of your employer’s traditional 401(k) match. If your budget allows you to contribute more than that, or your employer doesn’t offer a match, answer this: Do you expect your tax bracket in retirement to be higher than it is now?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If yes, prioritize the Roth. But if you think you’ll retire with a similar lifestyle to your current one, focus on the 401(k).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you’re unsure of your retirement plans (fair) use this rule of thumb: Prioritize Roth if you’re early in your career, and traditional options if you’re mid- to late-career. In the end, as long as you’re contributing to a retirement plan, you’re doing the right thing.</p>

width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYour dreams of trying an authentic Montreal bagel are still limited to allowing a New York City one to get stale. Yesterday, Canada \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/world/us/canada-extends-us-travel-restrictions-through-july-21-2021-06-18/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eextended restrictions\u003c/a\u003e on nonessential travel across the US border until July 22.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThose restrictions have been in place since March 2020, when countries across the globe shut down international travel to curb the spread of Covid-19.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eMany are, in a word, frustrated\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe US’ and Canada’s economies are more intertwined than CatDog.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd while goods can be shuttled between the two countries, the tourism and services industries on both sides of the border are feeling the pinch. Lawmakers and businesses in both the US and Canada have \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/canada-extends-ban-non-essential-travel-with-us-until-july-21-2021-06-18/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elashed out\u003c/a\u003e at the Canadian government for what they say is putting politics over science.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“The complete lockdown we’ve experienced is not consistent with science and it’s very, very bad for our economy,” said US Rep. Chris Jacobs of New York.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\"We need to open the border for fully vaccinated travelers immediately,\" Harley Finkelstein, the president of Canadian ecommerce giant Shopify, tweeted.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAbout those vaccinations...\u003c/strong\u003eto keep the virus at bay, Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has said the border would stay mostly closed until 75% of the population has received the first dose and 20% have been fully vaccinated. As of yesterday, 65% had received a first dose and nearly 17% had been fully vaxxed, per the \u003ca href=\"https://covid19tracker.ca/vaccinationtracker.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCovid-19 Tracker Canada project\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eCanadian and American businesses that rely on cross-border traffic are getting FOMO as other countries open up to international travelers. Yesterday, the European Council \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/eu-lifts-travel-restrictions-for-us-travelers/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecommended\u003c/a\u003e that EU countries gradually lift restrictions on non-essential travel from 14 With a record-breaking heat wave sizzling its way across the West this week, officials will almost certainly declare the first-ever water shortage for the Colorado River, which feeds Lake Mead.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe shortage will affect much more than Californians’ shower times. No “good” in this list but here’s...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe bad: agriculture. \u003c/strong\u003eRising water prices and dwindling government subsidies means farmers are letting fields of almonds (one of California’s most lucrative crops), tomatoes, and other produce \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/drought-imperils-economy-in-californias-farm-country-11621589407?mod=article_inline\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ego fallow\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe ugly: fishing. \u003c/strong\u003e17 million salmon are being \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2021/jun/11/california-to-transport-17m-salmon-to-the-sea-by-truck-as-drought-bites?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003echauffeured\u003c/a\u003e from drying rivers to the ocean, possibly costing more than $800,000 but saving 23,000 industry jobs.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe also-bad-and-ugly:\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003epower.\u003c/strong\u003e Grids are already struggling to keep the A/C running, and capacity at hydroelectric power facilities is \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/west-risks-blackouts-as-hydroelectric-power-dries-up-11624008601?mod=hp_lead_pos6\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplummeting\u003c/a\u003e. At Lake Mead’s Hoover Dam, it’s down 25%.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn 2021, even Santa isn’t immune to supply chain fiascos. Severe backlogs at Chinese ports are \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/06/17/business/china-ports-global-supply-chain-intl-hnk/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethreatening disruptions\u003c/a\u003e in electronics, appliances, furniture, and toys just as the retail industry prepares for its peak holiday shipping season in August.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory\u003c/strong\u003e: The worst of the shipping bottleneck is at Yantian, the largest port in China and the one that exports \u003e90% of the world’s electronics. Last month, a spike in Covid cases led to a total lockdown in Guangdong, the southern Chinese province where Yantian and other busy ports are located, for about a week. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCases have since dropped and the port is back to operating at about 70% capacity, but it’s too late. ~160,000 containers are still waiting to be shipped, and experts \u003ca href=\"https://www.scmp.com/economy/china-economy/article/3137920/china-shipping-yantian-port-delays-already-worse-those-caused?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esay\u003c/a\u003e the delays caused by this backlog are worse than when the Ever Given got stuck in the Suez Canal.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eIn this new Summer 2021 segment, the Brew’s personal finance writer Ryan Lasker is nose-diving into our inbox to address your personal finance questions. \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://link.morningbrew.com/click/24127283.23936/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9tMDZUYmRVUz91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77B5ca46cdd?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eSubmit your money woes here\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eI have recently been hired for my first full-time position. The company is offering a 401(k) plan, but I also have a separate Roth IRA. Which one should I prioritize maxing out first?—Calla from Hawaii\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCongrats on the new gig. I’m going to use you as a shining example that it’s never too early to save for retirement.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTo answer your question, those sweet, sweet tax benefits of 401(k) and IRA retirement plans come in two flavors: traditional and Roth.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTraditional plans\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e let you contribute a portion of your paycheck before income taxes, but you’ll pay them on withdrawals in retirement. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRoth plan\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e contributions are taxed now, not later.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYour \u003cem\u003efirst\u003c/em\u003e priority should be to take advantage of your employer’s traditional 401(k) match. If your budget allows you to contribute more than that, or your employer doesn’t offer a match, answer this: Do you expect your tax bracket in retirement to be higher than it is now?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf yes, prioritize the Roth. But if you think you’ll retire with a similar lifestyle to your current one, focus on the 401(k).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you’re unsure of your retirement plans (fair) use this rule of thumb: Prioritize Roth if you’re early in your career, and traditional options if you’re mid- to late-career. In the end, as long as you’re contributing to a retirement plan, you’re doing the right thing.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\"
